sentence.idiomatic: We should deal seriously with people who don't abide by the rules.
We should handle this problem seriously.
He sternly criticizes students who don't abide by the rules.
In a football game, all of the players must work together.
Thanks for your cooperation.
We need everyone's cooperation to complete this task.
We should consciously abide by the rules.
We should follow the traffic rules.
He is someone who can keep his promise.
Let children develop the habit of studying on their own.
She can always study on her own initiative.
We should take the initiative to abide the traffic rules.

word.literal: to not be able to keep up with

sentence.idiomatic: The plans can't keep up with the changes.

word.literal: to not be able to keep up with

sentence.idiomatic: She has fallen behind in her studies.

word.literal: to not be able to keep up with

sentence.idiomatic: He has already fallen behind us.

word.literal: to not be able to pass

sentence.idiomatic: Hurry up and study, otherwise you won't be able to pass the test.
Hurry up or we'll be late.
Please take off your wet clothes or you'll catch a cold.
She is always listening intently in class.
You should be focused on listening to the lectures.
You should listen intently to the teacher in class.
Restlessness is a natural characteristic of children.
He is very active.
There are always some children who are restless in class.
Children often do not concentrate when they are doing things.
You definitely need to concentrate when you are in class.
He is focused on reviewing.
All children are naughty.
When he was a child, he was very naughty.
He is a naughty boy.
In general, this place is fine.
Generally speaking, this job is not too difficult.
In general, his grades are all right.
His parents really spoiled him.
She is spoiled by her parents.
She is really spoiled at home.
Hello Teacher Zhang. Has my son been doing all right lately?
In general, not bad. His grades have improved. It’s just that sometimes he is a bit naughty. He doesn’t concentrate in class.
That’s true, boys are always more active. That’s my son’s personality. But the most important thing is that his grades have improved.

word.literal: to be unable to keep up

sentence.idiomatic: But his misbehavior can easily influence his studies. What we are studying now is harder than before, and during class it is essential to pay attention to what is being taught. Otherwise, he won’t be able to keep up.
You are right. When I get home I will lecture him on abiding by the rules in class, and to pay attention to what you are teaching. But sometimes it’s very difficult to change one’s personality.
The cooperation of the parents is very important. It would be best if you had a serious talk with him. It is for his own good.
You’re right. Sometimes we spoil him too much. We need to make some changes.
I’m sorry, but we don’t have much time for the Parent-Teacher Meeting today. If you have any questions, please give me a call anytime.
All right. Thank you for your hard work, teacher.

word.literal: to be unable to keep up
